About KopiJunkie

My name's Kimmi. I build web sites and apps for desktops and mobile.

I like to create engaging web sites, apps with interesting user interfaces using modern web technologies. Having completed a Computer Science conversion course, I also do back end development now. I also enjoy doing some graphics razzle dazzle on the side.

My first web site was on Geocities back in the 90s, made on a Windows PC using Notepad to write the HTML, styling and Paint to make very basic graphics complete with autoplaying MIDI sound file and a blinking, scrolling marquee. Basically everything a web site should be plus everything it shouldn't be. But don't worry, I'm wiser now having more experience developing web sites since then, first as a hobby then as my day-to-day job. Definitely way past that phase now and I know better than to develop something tacky.

About This Web Site

Kopijunkie.net in its current incarnation was developed using front end technologies, specifically:

  • Static Site Generator: Assemble
  • Automated JavaScript Task Runner: Grunt
  • Front End Dependencies Manager: Bower
  • CSS Preprocessor: Sass
    • Mixin Library: Bourbon
    • Grid Framework: Neat

All images, aside from the social media icons, were created or manipulated on a healthy mix of Photoshop, GIMP and Inkscape.

More About Me

Still want to know more? I'm a Malaysian girl geek and front end developer currently based in London. I did a Computer Science masters degree at the University of Bristol and used to work in Singapore handling corporate events and conference services at a 5-star hotel until I decided that I wanted to build web sites for a living, not just as a hobby. Before my first working life, I studied at Monash University, Australia majoring in Mass Communication. (Yes, I've been around quite a bit!)

I have a strong interest in using digital technology to deliver media and information to the masses. Front end development is the perfect fit for my interest in bringing mass media (what I studied previously) and technology (my current skill set) together.

Right now I'm a Front End Developer working on a visual analytics web app product at cube19. Previously I was at a digital agency, Vexed Digital (now known as Future Platforms) making web sites and apps for a variety of clients including Domino's Pizza and the De Vere Group.

When I'm not busy being a geek, I like to kick back with a good book, comic, or movie or play video games. I also play football (or "soccer" to some) with Old Actonians LFC. While at university in Bristol, a gig review I wrote was published on Intuition, an online student lifestyle and culture magazine. These days I prefer to just enjoy a music gig rather than pick it apart for a review. Occasionally, I sketch stuff of a cartoon-ish nature for the fun of it like the "self caricature" pencil sketch.

For a more detailed description of my skills and work experience, head over to my LinkedIn profile.
